reviewText: Love the characters in Gunsmoke. They seem like old friends. It's amazing how Matt always wins all the gun fights.
Like most fans I don't like the seasons being split into 'volumes" But Gunsmoke is so great, I have to go along with it.
purchased for spouse who loves Gunsmoke and she is just exceptionally happy with this item. Looking forward to future releases of the series.

These are the 32 early and last of the  half-hour  1960-1961  b/w  episodes..and they are also some of  the best. Before they went to  one hour and color  to  keep up with the other shows on the other networks. As Milburne Stone said in a TV-Guide article .".at last, there were guest stars that carried the episodes and only at the last minute Matt came in to save everyone and shoot the bad guys." This Sixth Season  is the latest  full year collection to be relased to the public. Now,will we be seeing the 7th. Season and the first l-hour b/w shows of  34  from  1961-1962 which were also great, except they  were  starting to cut  some  action scenes  with more dialogue  supposed to flesh-out the characters.l And yes...This is another great  GUNSMOKE classic early TV  collection.

One particular episode on the season was viewed by my father and sister the night I was born and they chose my name from it. It was awesome for me to be able to watch this same episode so many years later. Both sound and viewing quality were very good. Well Done, thanx for helping bring this special moment into a reality in my heart.
I love Gunsmoke and wish they would put complete seasons like they did with Season 1. I will still buy them though.
I would give you my review but as of this time I have not even opened the DVD's up to watch them as I have been to busy.

But you will recognize a lot of the same character actors from season to season in this show.  Good quality DVD...no flaws.
Still collecting.  When does Season 12 come out?

Gunsmoke provides western-lovers with a family-friendly great show that emphasizes character, law & order, and good plain common sense. This half-season, as well as all previous episodes, provide a breath of fresh air in an age when many of the most entertaining movies have drifted from such character-building values. It is amazing to me that the writers were successful in making the plot and storyline consistently excellent and among the best of the classic Westerns from season to season for so many consecutive seasons. I cannot think of one episode to date that felt weak or that let me down.

Definitely a great addition for the video library of anyone who likes the Western genre, or who likes solid character and good role models in the primary characters, and a strengthening of the ideas of justice, fair play, the rule of law, and even compassion and wisdom throughout.

I listened to Gunsmoke on the radio as a child and have enjoyed watching these seasons, especially liking Chester and discontinued viewing when he went off the air. Festus was okay, but I liked old Chester.

These early seasons were very good at giving lessons on life through Matt Dillon.
James Arness played the role perfectly.

I am really HAPPY with this second volume for SEASON 6 of GUNSMOKE. The episodes were extremely high quality and each and every story was exceptionally well done. This edition marks the END of the GUNSMOKE half-hour format, before they moved to hour-long episodes. The sparkling Black and White photography still maintains a solid visual edge, giving each episode a stark, gritty quality. The stories are also well compsoed and tightly written. I am a bit disappointed that there are no real 'extras' to be found ( except a few original sponsor commercials) but at these prices (around $20.) the overall entertainment value of these packages is so high that I really can't complain. LOTS of great action, drama and character humor in each and every episode, making viewing GUNSMOKE a terrific way to end your work day.
My In-law is a western nut and loved the shows.  He has been a Gunsmoke fan for years and will watch the CD series many times over and over.
Husband loves it.  Well received.  Thanks.  He is a hugh fan and collector of all things Gunsmoke.  Thanks for keeping items in stock and available for a resonable price.
MAT  DILLON BRINGS LAW AND ORDER (AND OFTEN JUSTICE) TO THE KANSAS FRONTIER OF THE 1870S.  DENNIS WEAVER IS EXCELLENT AS MATT'S SIDEKICK, CHESTER GOOD.

This was a great series of how men and women survived in the post civil war days of Dodge City, Kansas. Life was cheap and so was the booze at the Longbranch. No episode reflected this better than the 1st episode of Season 6, Vol. 2. It was sarcastically titled Love Thy Neighbor. It was an excellent half-hour of retribution with a cast to die for: Jeannette Nolan, Harry Dean Stanton, Jack Elam, and Warren Oates. It was amazing how much story the intelligent writers could cram into 25 minutes.

There were tons of westerns in the 50's and 60's, but GUNSMOKE was the gold standard.

Gunsmoke was a great series.  I enjoy the series better in black and white (I think they went to color in season 11) and I like them better with Chester (through season 9).  Gunsmoke was very well written and a great western TV series.  If you enjoy westerns, you can't go wrong with Gunsmoke.  (I just wish Chester had been featured more.) Classic TV at its best.
Once again, reminiscent of the 60's and the way TV shows 'were done' - can't beat it.  I am getting each year slowly but surely (can't afford to buy them all - for my mother)

In order to save time, I would like to cover all the seasons in general with this review.  I can only say that I grately appreciated how the producers of this series researched that way of life before making all their episodes.  It was as true to life as possible with a touch of flare for the viewing audience.  If you want to get a taste of how life was like back in the 1800's, just watch a few episodes of Gunsmoke.  You'll appreciate all of the modern conveniences in your life a bit more.  The actors are seasoned to the series and work together like a well oiled machine.  When you work with someone for 20 years, you concider yourself almost married to them, knowing their personalities and strong points, as well as their weaknesses.  That is what made this series so special.  There was substance because of their long careers together.  It's nice to see how everyone had the same goal in mind, to make "Gunsmoke" as realistic as possible.  That's what made it so enjoyable for me.  You get to see how a piece of the past  really was.  It draws the viewer into it's plot with gentle persuasion and captivates you with suspense.  You feel like you are right there in the midst of it.  You will cry and laugh and celebrate their lives as you see the actors aging with grace everystep of the way.  Only a few  series, this being one of them, were able to captivate us with heart tugs and emotions as we too progressed in age right along with them.  They became our friends and to some, family.  Now I find myself watching these old programs and thinking back to my childhood, remembering how my parents would tune into their favorite show on TV every Monday evening to watch Festus and old Doc get into another fracas over Festus' wild conclusions, or when will Marshall Dillon propose to Miss Kitty, (a big unanswered question mark left  in that series). It brings me back to a happier time in my life too.  I remember when my parents were younger and able bodied and I was in grade school with lots of time to kill during summer vaction.  It was more than just a TV show to many folks. You won't see space ships blow up the earth or endless car chases all over the city, but you will see realalistic situations with real emotions of how life was for our forefathers 150 years ago.  I would like to end my review with my recommendation,  I can assure you, if you choose to purchase this series, you will not be disappointed.  You will see for yourself why it lasted 2o years.

Fifty years plus since first shown, "Gunsmoke" still holds up as one of the best television series ever.  Wonderful characters, consis-tently good stories and polished production values make this terrific old series still very relevant today.  Not to be dismissed as just an old western show, this is quality tv that goes beyond that genre.
I love seeing Doc and Miss Kitty in their younger days. I don't remember these 1/2 hour episodes so this is a real treat.
There is nothing like watching a great episode of Gunsmoke. Shows like this are well done and stand the test of time. I hope all young people will watch this show.
